Carlos Gomez.description: meeting with Isabella at a local coffee shop (reviewing his notes for the meeting) @ the Ville:Carlos Gomez's apartment:main room:desk

Klaus Mueller.description: meeting with Isabella Rodriguez and Wolfgang Schulz at the community center to discuss their project on gentrification (sharing his ideas for incorporating Carlos Gomez's poetry and traditional African music) @ the Ville:Dorm for Oak Hill College:common room:common room table

Sam Moore.description: running errands and checking emails (picking up dry cleaning) @ the Ville:The Willows Market and Pharmacy:store:behind the pharmacy counter

Ayesha Khan.description: attending her fourth class at Oak Hill College (conversing about collaborating on a project focusing on incorporating themes of resilience and empowerment from the Black community, involving Black artists and community members, educating themselves on the struggles and experiences of the Black community, prioritizing their representation and contributions, and actively engaging with them in decision-making processes to create a meaningful and impactful work.) @ the Ville:Carlos Gomez's apartment:main room:desk

Wolfgang Schulz.description: studying or working on projects (conversing about how to authentically represent the Black community's perspectives by incorporating spoken word elements, traditional African music, involving Black artists and storytellers, collaborating with local community organizations, celebrating resilience and strength, creating safe and inclusive spaces, educating themselves on Black history and struggles, continuously seeking feedback, organizing listening sessions, and prioritizing empowering Black voices in their project.) @ the Ville:artist's co-living space:common room:common room sofa

Eddy Lin.description: working on his composition project at Hobbs Cafe (conversing about how to authentically represent the Black community's perspectives by incorporating spoken word elements, traditional African music, involving Black artists and storytellers, collaborating with local community organizations, celebrating resilience and strength, creating safe and inclusive spaces, educating themselves on Black history and struggles, continuously seeking feedback, organizing listening sessions, and prioritizing empowering Black voices in their project.) @ the Ville:artist's co-living space:common room:common room sofa
